text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Kuwait's press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Oil Minister Isa al-Mazeedi says Kuwaiti petrol station workers to keep their jobs. Kuwait has said it plans to sell 30 local petrol stations of some 80 stations it holds to private investors under a privatisation programme. MPs have voiced concern over the jobs of Kuwaiti employees.
- Acting Prime Minister Sheikh Sabah al-Ahmad al-Sabah receives messages from Iranian Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Velayati and Egyptian Foreign Minister Amr Moussa.
- Parliament approves a two-million-dinar ($6.7 million) budget to start own newspaper.
- Crown Prince and Prime Minister Sheikh Saad al-Abdulla al-Sabah reaffirms Kuwait's desire to boost ties with the United States.
- Communications Ministry studies possible cuts in international calls charges.
